DOC.brief_summary: Plasmodium falciparum parasitaemia pregnancy associate maternal anaemia , low birth-weight increase perinatal mortality . Whilst continuous prophylaxis difficult implement , intermittent presumptive treatment pregnancy ( IPTp ) prove practical effective . In PNG , pregnant woman currently receive IPTp use sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine , however , therapy potential compromise parasite resistance . The aim present trial ass safety , tolerability , pharmacokinetics efficacy azithromycin ( AZI ) plus piperaquine ( PQ ) give IPTp pregnant Papua New Guinea woman . The study comprise two sub-studies : ( ) A safety , tolerability pharmacokinetic study AZI-PQ pregnancy . ( ii ) A safety , tolerability preliminary efficacy study AZI-PQ pregnancy .
DOC.brief_title: A Safety , Tolerability , Pharmacokinetic Efficacy Study Azithromycin Plus Piperaquine Presumptive Treatment Pregnant PNG Women
